content: the prisoner of azkaban hogwarts scarves are very different from the old scarves where egalitarian stripes where the norm i have created a pattern inspired on the poa aka prisoner of azkaban scarves materials 7 ounces of main color 2 ounces or more of contrasting color hook size i darning needle and scissors poa crochet scarf version main pattern how to make a chain * see note below when changing colors cut yarn and leave at least a 6 to 10 inch tail to weave with main color and crochet hook i or size you prefer chain 30 beginning row half_double_crochet in second chain from hook and in each chain for a total of 29 half_double_crochet stitches turn row 1 chain 2 count chain 2 as first half_double_crochet half_double_crochet in each stitch across for 29 stitches turn row 2 - 21 repeat row 1 row 22 repeat row 1 but change colors in last half_double_crochet ** see note on how to change colors below row 23-24 repeat row 1 with contrasting color on row 24 last half_double_crochet change colors to main color row 25-27 repeat row 1 with main color on row 27 last half_double_crochet change colors to contrasting color row 28-29 repeat row 1 with contrasting color on row 29 last half_double_crochet change colors to main color keep repeating row 1-29 as much as you need to until it reaches about 56 inches or the length that you desire then finish with row 1-22 finishing weave the ends add fringe to your liking short long every stitch every other stitch one or two strands this is a personal touch * start with a loop on the hook hook yarn and pull through one chain completed ** when ready to change to a different color make your half_double_crochet in the old color on the last stitch then pull the new color through the three loops on the hook to complete that half_double_crochet or half_double_crochet you can watch the video as well by clicking here if you are more of a visual person crafty andy© 2007 it is an original work and may be used for non-commercial purposes only important note harry potter hogwarts gryffindor slytherin ravenclaw and hufflepuff are registered trademarks and copyright of j k rowling scholastic warner brother bloomsbury et al the rest of the content on this page is copyrighted to crafty andy
